question.text: Which is false for vexillary or papilionaceous aestivation?

options.text: Two smallest anterior petals are known as keel.
Two lateral petals are known as wing.
The largest standard petal is posterior.
The largest standard petal is anterior and overlaps wing.

solution.text: In vexillary aestivation the largest posterior petal is called as standard or vexillum, two lateral petals are called as wings and the two anterior smallest petals which are fused are known as keel. Vexillary aestivation thus shows  <math><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>   arrangement of petals.
